Typealiases.html#/s:15LittleBlueTooth0ab.name: LittleBlueToothServiceIndentifier
Typealiases.html#/s:15LittleBlueTooth0ab.abstract: Type alias for a CBUUID string used to identify services

Typealiases.html#/s:15LittleBlueTooth0ab.name: LittleBlueToothCharacteristicIndentifier
Typealiases.html#/s:15LittleBlueTooth0ab.abstract: Type alias for a CBUUID string used to identify characteristic

Typealiases.html#/s:15LittleBlueTooth21A.name: AutoconnectionHandler
Typealiases.html#/s:15LittleBlueTooth21A.abstract: Pass a Peripheral and an evetual LittleBluetoothError and expect a boolean as an answer

Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.name: centralManagerOptions
Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.abstract: CBCentralManager options dictionary for instance the restore identifier, thay are the same

Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.name: autoconnectionHandler
Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.abstract: This handler must be used to handle connection process after a disconnession.

Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.name: restoreHandler
Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.abstract: Handler used to manage state restoration. Restored object will contain the restored information

Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.name: isLogEnabled
Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.abstract: Enable logging, log is made using os_log and it exposes some information even in release configuration

Structs/LittleBlueToothCharacteristic.ht.name: properties
Structs/LittleBlueToothCharacteristic.ht.abstract: Properties of the characteristic. They are mapped from CBCharacteristicProperties

Structs/LittleBlueToothCharacteristic.ht.name: value()
Structs/LittleBlueToothCharacteristic.ht.abstract: A helper method to get a concrete value from the value contained in the characteristic.
If two LittleBlueToothCharacteristic are compared and they have the same characteristic and service identifier they are equal

Structs/LittleBlueToothCharacteristic/Pr.name: Properties
Structs/LittleBlueToothCharacteristic/Pr.abstract: Permitted operations on the characteristic they already exist in CBCharacteristic need to remap when initialized from CBCharacteristic

Structs/CentralRestorer.html#/s:15Little.name: peripherals
Structs/CentralRestorer.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Array of PeripheralIdentifier objects which have been restored.

Structs/CentralRestorer.html#/s:15Little.name: scanOptions
Structs/CentralRestorer.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Dictionary that contains all of the peripheral scan options that were being used

Structs/CentralRestorer.html#/s:15Little.name: services
Structs/CentralRestorer.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Array of CBUUID objects of services which have been restored.

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: init(advertisementData:)
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Creates advertisement data based on CoreBluetooth’s dictionary

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: localName
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: A string containing the local name of a peripheral.

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: manufacturerData
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: A Data object containing the manufacturer data of a peripheral.

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: overflowServiceUUIDs
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: An array of one or more CBUUID objects, representing CBService UUIDs that were found in the “overflow”

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: txPowerLevel
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: A number (an instance of NSNumber) containing the transmit power of a peripheral.

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: isConnectable
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the advertising event type is connectable.

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.name: solicitedServiceUUIDs
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html#/s:15Little.abstract: An array of one or more CBUUID objects, representing CBService UUIDs.

Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html.name: AdvertisingInfo
Structs/AdvertisingInfo.html.abstract: A wrapper around the advertisement data returned from a BLE device.

Structs/CentralRestorer.html.name: CentralRestorer
Structs/CentralRestorer.html.abstract: This object contains parsed information passed from the centralManager(_ central: CBCentralManager, willRestoreState dict: [String : Any]) method of CBCentralManagerDelegate dictionary

Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.name: LittleBluetoothConfiguration
Structs/LittleBluetoothConfiguration.htm.abstract: Configuration object that must be passed during the LittleBlueTooth initialization

Structs/PeripheralIdentifier.html.name: PeripheralIdentifier
Structs/PeripheralIdentifier.html.abstract: An object that contains the unique identifier of the CBPeripheral and the name of it (if present)

Structs/PeripheralDiscovery.html.name: PeripheralDiscovery
Structs/PeripheralDiscovery.html.abstract: An object that contains the unique identifier of the CBPeripheral, the name of it (if present) and the advertising info.

Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.name: extract(start:length:)
Extensions/Data.html#/s:10Foundation4Dat.abstract: Deserialize a range of Data into a specific type

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: shareReplay(_:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Provides a subject that shares a single subscription to the upstream publisher and replays at most bufferSize items emitted by that publisher

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: enableListen(for:from:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Returns a publisher with the LittleBlueToothCharacteristic where the notify command has been activated.

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: startListen(for:from:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Returns a shared publisher for listening to a specific characteristic.

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: readRSSI(for:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Returns a publisher with the Intvalue of the RSSI.

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: read(for:from:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Read a value from a specific charteristic

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: write(for:to:value:response:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Write a value to a specific charteristic

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: writeAndListen(for:from:value:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Write a value to a specific charteristic and wait for a response

Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.name: timeout(_:scheduler:options:error:)
Extensions/Publisher.html#/s:7Combine9Pu.abstract: Specialized timeout function to return a LittleBluetoothError error type. By default it returns .operationTimeout, but you can specify a different error such as .connectionTimeout, .scanTimeout

Enums/BluetoothState.html#/s:15LittleBlu.name: unsupported
Enums/BluetoothState.html#/s:15LittleBlu.abstract: Bluetooth is not supported for this device

Enums/BluetoothState.html#/s:15LittleBlu.name: unauthorized
Enums/BluetoothState.html#/s:15LittleBlu.abstract: The application is not authorized to use bluetooth

Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: connected(_:)
Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Peripheral is connected but not ready to receive command

Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: autoConnected(_:)
Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Peripheral is connected after a disconnection automatically but not ready to receive command

Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: notReady(_:error:)
Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Peripheral is not ready probaly due to some unexpected disconnection

Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: disconnected(_:error:)
Enums/ConnectionEvent.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Peripheral has been disconnected, if it was unexpected a LittleBluetoothError is returned

Enums/PeripheralState.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: unknown
Enums/PeripheralState.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: The peripheral state is not know, could be transitory

Enums/LittleBluetoothError.html.name: LittleBluetoothError
Enums/LittleBluetoothError.html.abstract: Collection of errors that can be returned by LittleBlueTooth

Enums/Restored.html.name: Restored
Enums/Restored.html.abstract: This object contains the restored action during state restoration

Enums/PeripheralChanges.html.name: PeripheralChanges
Enums/PeripheralChanges.html.abstract: An enumeration that represent the changes in peripheral services or name

Enums/ConnectionEvent.html.name: ConnectionEvent
Enums/ConnectionEvent.html.abstract: An enum representing the connection event that has occurred

Enums/BluetoothState.html.name: BluetoothState
Enums/BluetoothState.html.abstract: An enumeration representing the state of the bluetooth stack of the device

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: connectionTasks
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: This is usefull when you have auto-reconnection and want to do some task right after a connection.

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: autoconnectionHandler
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: This handler must be used to handle connection process after a disconnession.

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: peripheral
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Connected peripheral. nil if not connected or a connection is not requested

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: peripheralStatePublisher
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Publisher that streams peripheral state available only when a connection is requested for fine grained control

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: listenPublisher
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Publish all values from LittleBlueToothCharacteristic that you are already listening to.

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: connectableListenPublisher(for:valueType:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Returns a multicast publisher once you attached all the subscriber you must call connect()

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: startListen(from:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Returns a shared publisher for listening to a specific characteristic.

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: enableListen(from:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Returns a publisher with the LittleBlueToothCharacteristic where the notify command has been activated.

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: read(from:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Read a value from a specific charteristic

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: write(to:value:response:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Write a value to a specific charteristic

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: writeAndListen(from:value:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Write a value to a specific charteristic and wait for a response

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: extract()
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Sometimes you may need to extract CBCentralManager and CBPeripheral

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.name: assemble(_:)
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html#/s:15Little.abstract: Function to create a Data object from an array of Writable objects

Classes/ReplaySubjectSubscription.html#/.name: request(_:)
Classes/ReplaySubjectSubscription.html#/.abstract: Tells a publisher that it may send more values to the subscriber.

Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: init(_:)
Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Initialize a ReplaySubject subject with a buffer size

Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: send(subscription:)
Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Provides this Subject an opportunity to establish demand for any new upstream subscriptions

Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: send(completion:)
Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: Sends a completion signal to the subscriber.

Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.name: receive(subscriber:)
Classes/ReplaySubject.html#/s:15LittleBl.abstract: This function is called to attach the specified Subscriber to the`Publisher

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:15LittleBlueT.name: id
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:15LittleBlueT.abstract: An identifier for the peripheral it is the same as the wrapped CBPeripheral

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:15LittleBlueT.name: name
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:15LittleBlueT.abstract: The name of the peripheral it is the same as the wrapped CBPeripheral

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:15LittleBlueT.name: state
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:15LittleBlueT.abstract: The state of the peripheral it is the same as the wrapped CBPeripheral

Classes/Peripheral.html.name: Peripheral
Classes/Peripheral.html.abstract: It represents a peripheral along with its properties

Classes/ReplaySubject.html.name: ReplaySubject
Classes/ReplaySubject.html.abstract: The ShareReplay is used to share a single subscription to the upstream publisher and replay items emitted by that one.

Classes/ReplaySubjectSubscription.html.name: ReplaySubjectSubscription
Classes/ReplaySubjectSubscription.html.abstract: A class representing the connection of a subscriber to a publisher.

Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html.name: LittleBlueTooth
Classes/LittleBlueTooth.html.abstract: LittleBlueTooth can control only one peripheral at time. It has an id properties to identifiy different instances.

Global%20Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
